Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery olpe; interior glazed streaky black; band in added red band on top of rim; on outside of lip, careless chequerboard frieze; below, narrow black band above part of undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1836,0224.61 and 1836,0224.39 from Vulci.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0318) (Phase 1)
